content: I made #14647 in a purely import-directed way: feedback, especially by combinatorialists, very welcome!
Uh, are you sure this PR achieves anything import-wise?
I was proposing something very similar here! I wonder if having a Walk file with a WalkCounting section would make more sense. What do you think?
I thought it did, and then I was disappointed to see it didn't... though reducing that huge file also seems like progress.

Rida Hamadani said:

I was proposing something very similar here! I wonder if having a Walk file with a WalkCounting section would make more sense. What do you think?

Interesting thought! The first part of Connectivity certainly splits off nicely...
I wonder if having one file with the basic definitions first is nice (e.g., Connectivity/Defs.lean, which could define Walk, Path, Trail etc.). Then Walk.lean could show basic properties of walks... that part seems long enough, so perhaps walk counting could be yet another different file.

I made a start in branch#MR-split-combinatorics-graphs-harder, but probably won't have time to pursue this further. Be my guest to try such a split!
(That said: I'm not a combinatorics maintainer. Maybe the experts prefer a different split; this I don't know.)
#10329 is related, but it stayed many months without any activity.
To avoid the same problem, maybe it is a good idea to make multiple PRs, each of which moves small parts of Connectivity.lean?
